topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5588682563687211160003e3#post_5588682563687211160003e3
They might have found a gene that if you activate it reverses cancer by inhibiting cell division.  It's just theory right now, but if it pans out basically you would get a single gene therapy shot and on top of regular cancer medication it could drastically reduce it.

Basically let's say you had inoperable terminal brain cancer; using gene therapy would shrink it enough on top of traditional medicine to make it easier to treat.

topics.body:
"Life is a series of obstacles. It's not a question of can we manage them, but how. Sometimes they can come all at once. But we can't CONQUER them all at once."

"So what do I do? How can I focus on one goal with so much going on inside my head."

"You relax. You release. You find your center. Only then will be successful."

Master Swoop is the fucking coolest!

topics.body:
I know you guys want to move onto a different discussion, but I thought of something interesting: the most probable reason why there's so much drama currently on the internet with people complaining about how they have a "right" to reproduce, sjw, tumblrites, "nice guys" who aren't actually nice and are just using the label to try to label themselves in a more positive light, etc is that for a hundred thousand years it was a requirement to reproduce in order to survive.  It didn't matter how fucking terrible of a person you were someone would eventually have to reproduce with you in order for their offspring to support them as they aged and got older.

If you remove that need to reproduce in order to survive from society well then guess what happens to all the people who believe it's their "right" to reproduce?
